result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Fish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Complaints [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(2).
  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with case no. 14-CM-214. Consecutive to case no. 14-CF-107.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment as determined by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Take medications as prescribed.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 7, 8. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 7, 8. Counts 1-6 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations (not joint). Defendant makes statement. Discussion regarding sentence credit. Bond no longer in effect.
from State regarding Defendant's mental health issues

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has leads to pursue, would like to get statements from people, requests one additional status.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Andrew P. Mongin.  Defendant James D Fish in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Mongin requests another status in 30 days to allow him time to get up to speed on all cases. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference at 07-20-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews Petition filed by Defense to withdraw. Defense advises of Defendant's request that he withdraw as his attorney. Court questions Defendant, who agrees that he wants Atty Van Ells to withdraw. Court grants petition to withdraw. Atty Van Ells will drop file off at PD's office tomorrow. Discussion regarding prior counsel. Court advises Defendant to contact PD's office about appointing counsel. Defense advises of witnesses who were coming at 3:30 to address bond. Court does not see bond modification motion. Court removes jury trial from calendar, questions Defendant on whether he wants to address bond now or later with counsel, but cannot do both. Atty Gerbers thinks it may take a week to find successor counsel. Defendant presents argument for reduced bond (has insurance card re: Bellin Psych, eviction, possessions still in home). Court is not likely to modify bond due to personal issues, would look at mental health issues when presented with an attorney. State questions what Defendant's witnesses have to do with mental health issues.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
to Withdraw as Counsel of Record

Defendant James D Fish appeared by video conference. Attorney Brian David Van Ells appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding Defendant's previous representation regarding inpatient treatment. Defense advises that County will facilitate treatment arrangements if Defendant is released on bond, but will not put him to the front of the line. Defense advises of medical insurance that will pay for inpatient treatment, advises that doctors at Winnebago have changed his medication, request signature bond or small cash bond. State opposes modification request, advises of incident in jail, transportation to Winnebago, presents Court with Jail report (Exh. 1). Court questions insurance. Defense/State present arguments. Court will not modify bond, wants proof that insurance would cover voluntary inpatient stay.

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that cases be set for trial and pre-trial, requests that bond be revisited. Defense requests bail be addressed before trial be addressed. State has received no new complaints from jail. Deputy Schwartz agrees. Court questions Defendant, who advises that he has not even received a verbal warning. Defense presents argument for reduced bond, advises of inpatient mental health evaluation at Bellin that would occur if released, advises that victim has moved to Oshkosh. Court makes statement that if he heard directly from Human Services that he would go directly for inpatient treatment, he would consider change back to signature bond.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted.
of Status Conference held 12/15/14
by State

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Court finds probable cause to believe Mr. Fish committed a felony.
Arraignment at 02-27-2015 04:00 pm
State's Memorandum of Law in Support of Bindover in Preliminary Hearing

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Brian David Van Ells. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding sequestration of witnesses. Testimony taken. Exhibit 2 - Letters from defendant to victim - offered and rec'd. Court questions State regarding letters. Defense makes statement. State presents argument. Court is not prepared to make ruling, will give parties until Friday to present written arguments. Bond continues as is.
Preliminary hearing on February 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.

from Atty Van Ells asking to reschedule 12/08/14 hearing because of a conflict.
Status conference on December 15, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Change of attorney
from defendant advising he wishes to fire Atty Singh.

Defendant James D Fish appears by video conference along with attorney Raj Kumar Singh who appears in person.  Defendant James D Fish in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of letter from defendant given to Atty Singh. Court reviews events in file, reviews letter from defendant whereas he's wanting to fire Atty Singh.  Court questions defendant on his request. Atty Singh advises he's made copies of all defendants files and will drop the copies off at the Sheriff Dept. to be given to Mr. Fish. Court relieves Atty Singh as attorney of record for all pending cases including revocation case. Court removes 11/26/14 preliminary hearings from the calendar. Atty Singh will advises SPD office that new counsel will have to be appointed to represent defendant. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with CF. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Raj Kumar Singh. Defendant James D Fish in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, receipt of evaluation of Dr. Galli. Defense makes statement. Court questions Defendant, who states he is competent to proceed. State was going to call Dr. Galli but will not based on Defendant's statement. Defense makes statement regarding Defendant's mental health. Court makes statement regarding letter received from Defendant. Defendant makes statement. Court finds Defendant competent to proceed. Court reviews where case stands, questions Defense on how to proceed. Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant James D Fish in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews competency evaluation done by Dr. Galli. Atty Schaefer makes oral motion to withdraw as defendant indicated to her he wishes to have new counsel appointed. Court questions defendant on his request for new counsel. Defendant confirms he wishes to have new counsel appointed. Court grants motion. Atty Gerbers is also present in court, indicates new counsel will be appointed to represent defendant.  Competency hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Report done by Dr. Galli.
from defendant asking for court help with mental health treatment. File DTE
for Competency Examination by DHS

Defendant James D Fish appears by video conference along with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer who appears in person.  Defendant James D Fish in custody.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, asks Court to set a status the same day as Competency hearing for other pending file. State not requesting a bond today, asks court to order a competency evaluation be done in this file also. Court orders competency evaluation be conducted. No bond set.  Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:45 am.
